page.title: 06PLAY FACILITIES IN WHADDON
page.content: IN JUNE 1985, CHILDREN FROM{LYNWORTH {AND WHADDON PRIMARY SCHOOLS}AND{ST. {MICHAEL'S PLAYGROUP}JOINED TOGETHER AND DREW SOME PICTURES OF SWINGS, SLIDES AND ROUNDABOUTS, THINGS WE WOULD LIKE IN{WHADDON RECREATION {GROUND}BECAUSE WHEN WE WANT TO GO TO AN ADVENTURE PLAYGROUND WE HAVE TO GO TO PITTVILLE PARK. IF YOU GO IN{ {WHADDON RECREATION GROUND}ALL YOU WILL SEE IS GRASS AND THE REMAINS OF AN OLD PAVILION. ALL THE WORK WE DID WENT ON SHOW IN TOWN, AT WHADDON SCHOOL AND LYNWORTH SCHOOL. AT WHADDON SCHOOL THERE ARE A LOT OF CHILDREN WHO LIVE AROUND THE AREA WHO WOULD LIKE THIS, ESPECIALLY THE ONES LIVING IN{CLYDE {CRESCENT}WHERE THE SCHOOL IS. THE BOYS CAN PLAY FOOTBALL BUT WE WOULD LIKE SOME SWINGS FOR THE GIRLS AS WELL.
